item.title: What is a Monoid, Exactly?
item.description:
Let’s talk about some math concepts in this context. Remember those lessons about identity, commutativity, associativity, and distributivity? These laws are quite important in the context of monoids. A monoid comes from mathematics. In abstract algebra, a monoid is a set equipped with an associative binary operation and an identity element.

Semigroup

In mathematics, a semigroup is a structure with a binary operation that satisfies the law of associativity.

An example of an associative operation would be addition, multiplication, or even string concatenation:
